item.title: Fixing Locale errors in Ubuntu
item.description: How to fix the following error when you are running apt-get update or installs. perl: warning: Setting locale failed. perl: warning: Please check that your locale settings: LANGUAGE = (unset), LC_ALL = (unset), LC_MONETARY = "en_US.ISO8859-1", LC_NUMERIC = "en_US.ISO8859-1", LC_MESSAGES = "C", LC_COLLATE = "en_US.ISO8859-1", LC_CTYPE = "en_US.ISO8859-1", LC_TIME = "en_US.ISO8859-1", LANG = "en_GB.UTF-8" export LC_ALL="en_GB.UTF-8" export LANGUAGE="en_GB.UTF-8" export LANG="en_GB.UTF-8" printf "LANGUAGE="en_GB.UTF-8"nLC_ALL="en_GB.UTF-8"" >> /etc/default/locale dpkg-reconfigure locales to test run
